article_title: ‘Cadillac’ Tax Delay Gives CFOs Breathing Room
article_text: Managing large data volumes in response to litigation or regulatory inquiry may become far more difficult when the discovery involves data sources across international borders, raising important questions about how to organize and conduct eDiscovery activities. Jessica Anderson, Deloitte Advisory director, Deloitte Transactions and Business Analytics LLP, discusses how committing to global data quality and consistency, making needed investments and looking for opportunities to innovate can help organizations meet continually growing discovery demands.

twitter.description: December’s omnibus budget package contained a measure to delay a provision of the Affordable Care Act by two years is giving finance chiefs some extra time to prepare.
twitter.title: ‘Cadillac’ Tax Delay Gives CFOs Breathing Room

article_summary:
Managing large data volumes in response to litigation or regulatory inquiry may become far more difficult when the discovery involves data sources across international borders, raising important questions about how to organize and conduct eDiscovery activities.
Jessica Anderson, Deloitte Advisory director, Deloitte Transactions and Business Analytics LLP, discusses how committing to global data quality and consistency, making needed investments and looking for opportunities to innovate can help organizations meet continually growing discovery demands.
